e4: Recommend implementing the new policy of without bias earnings while working closely with investor relations to communicate accurately and avoid any misconceptions, ensuring that both retail and sophisticated investors have access to fair information to level the trading field.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should consistently present accurate and unbiased financial data that reflects the true state of earnings per share. Regulatory compliance and legal accountability would provide legitimacy to these policies. The interests and welfare of all classes of investors – retail and institutional investors, should always be protected with proper disclosures of any necessary adjustments being made clear and accessible. Policymaking should recognize social responsibilities beyond simply preserving stock prices and take actions that build sustainable long-term trust in the business.
e6: Additional questions: 1) Has there been a change of circumstances since implementing to warrant a reevaluation of existing policy? If so, elucidate on what factors have provoked this reassessment. 2) Propose measures to ease communication challenges for investor relations in adjusting to the no-bias EPS reporting, such as dedicated briefings & training for staff to facilitate full disclosure.  3) Elaborate if possible strategies are planned to minimize or mitigate any harmful effects that could happen from a transition on all classes of investors (large and small), such as gradual rollouts overtime or temporary suspension/pause in the offering of new equity during the initial stages of adjustment.
